definition: to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
anti-missile missile (such as the Patriot Missile)

pinyin: fan3 jian4 ting3 xun2 hang2 dao3 dan4
dao3 dan4 wu3 qi4 ji4 shu4 kong4 zhi4 zhi4 du4
containing_words.word: 導彈武器技術控制制度

pinyin: zhou1 ji4 dan4 dao4 dao3 dan4

sentences.english: Russia says that Iran and North Korea do not have missiles capable of striking Europe.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯說，伊朗和北韓沒有掌握可以打擊歐洲的導彈。

sentences.english: Pictures of insurgents firing an anti-aircraft missile in Iraq .
sentences.chinese: 有關伊拉克叛亂分子發射防空導彈的錄像。

sentences.english: Besides, Russia is also working on the localization of strategic missile research, development and manufacturing.
sentences.chinese: 此外，戰略導彈研發生產本土化也是俄努力的方向。

sentences.english: Help Octo find the right answer before the missiles strike.
sentences.chinese: 幫助奧克託在導彈攻擊之前找到正確的答案。

sentences.english: Have you ever witnessed a missile launch?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾目睹過導彈發射？

sentences.english: The direct calculation method of precision conversion of long range antiship missile is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 探討了遠程反艦導彈精度摺合的直接推算方法。

sentences.english: The birth of rearward-firing missiles has changed the concept of aerial warfare, according to Wu.
sentences.chinese: 據吳聲稱，後射導彈的出現改變了空戰的概念。

sentences.english: Saab’s ARTHUR radar system locates incoming enemy projectiles and missiles.
sentences.chinese: ARTHUR雷達系統可定位敵方來襲炮彈和導彈。

sentences.english: South Korea will not confirm the missile-site report.
sentences.chinese: 韓國沒有證實有關導彈基地的報道。

sentences.english: I also believe an attack on a us carrier with a strategic missle would lead to nuclear retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信用戰略導彈攻擊美國航母會導致覈報復。

sentences.english: On May 26, North Korea test-fired two more missiles.
Objective To observe the traumatizing effects of an anti tank missile.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察某型反坦克導彈對犬的致傷效應。

sentences.english: The helicopter can carry up to eight missiles under the stub wings for anti-armour role.
sentences.chinese: 直升飛機能爲反裝甲任務在短翼下攜帶八枚導彈。

sentences.english: One of Schriever's colleagues observed that they had "introduced the president . . . to the nuclear missile age."
sentences.chinese: 施裏弗的一位同事稱，他們將總統帶進了核導彈時代。
潛艇發射的導彈相當的準確。

sentences.english: The influence of radar stealth technology on the penetration ability of anti-ship missile is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析了雷達隱身技術對反艦導彈突防能力的影響。

definition: to shoot (a projectile)/to fire (a rocket)/to launch/to emit (a particle)/to discharge/emanation/emission
to test-fire/to conduct a missile test
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
THAAD (Terminal High Altitude Area Defense), US Army anti-ballistic missile system
